Kementerian PUPR Bahas Skema Tarif Tol Layang Jakarta-Cikampek
01 Nov 2019, 06:42 by Antara, Kodrat Setiawan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Kepala Badan Pengatur Jalan Tol (BPJT) Kementerian Pekerjaan Umum dan Perumahan Rakyat (PUPR) Danang Parikesit mengatakan bahwa skema tarif untuk jalan Tol Layang Jakarta-Cikampek (Japek) II sedang dibahas berbagai pihak terkait.
Danang Parikesit dalam rilis Kementerian PUPR yang diterima di Jakarta, Jumat, 1 November 2019, menyatakan skema tarif tengah dibahas dan disesuaikan dengan tarif pada ruas tol eksisting atau dilakukan penyeimbangan. "Masih kami bahas terus dengan Ditjen Bina Marga dan PT. Jasa Marga, mudah-mudahan dapat disepakati skemanya sebelum Natal," kata dia.
Kementerian PUPR mempercepat pembangunan Japek II sepanjang 36,4 kilometer, di mana jalan tol itu dibangun untuk memperlancar arus barang dan mendukung kegiatan masyarakat kawasan metropolitan yang saat ini sudah sangat padat.
Tol Layang Jakarta Cikampek II diharapkan mendukung kelancaran mobilitas angkutan logistik dari Pelabuhan Tanjung Priok menuju tiga kawasan industri di Cikarang, Karawang, dan Cibitung maupun arus lalu lintas dari Jakarta ke arah Bandung dan ke arah Tol Trans Jawa.
"Sesuai arahan Bapak Menteri PUPR, Tol Japek II agar segera dioperasikan akhir November atau awal Desember 2019 supaya bisa digunakan saat mudik Natal dan Tahun Baru mendatang," katanya.
Tol Layang Japek II berada tepat di sebagian ruas Tol Jakarta-Cikampek eksisting, membentang dari ruas Cikunir hingga Karawang Barat (Sta 9+500 sampai dengan Sta 47+500).
Pengusahaannya dilakukan oleh Badan Usaha Jalan Tol (BUJT) PT Jasamarga Jalanlayang Cikampek (JJC) yang merupakan anak usaha dari PT. Jasa Marga.
Proyek pembangunan Jalan Tol Jakarta-Cikampek II Elevated merupakan bentuk kerja sama operasi (KSO) antara PT Waskita Karya (Persero) Tbk bersama PT Acset Indonusa Tbk, dengan biaya konstruksi sebesar Rp11,69 triliun.
Selain itu terdapat sembilan Zona Konstruksi yakni, Zona I Cikunir - Bekasi Barat sepanjang 2,94 km, Zona II Bekasi Barat - Bekasi Timur sepanjang 3,42 km, Zona III Bekasi Timur - Tambun sepanjang 4,40 km, Zona IV Tambun - Cibitung sepanjang 3,30 km, Zona V Cibitung - Cikarang Utama sepanjang 4,66 km, Zona VI Cikarang Utama - Cikarang Barat sepanjang 1,96 km, Zona VII Cikarang Barat - Cibatu sepanjang 3,11 km, Zona VIII Cibatu - Cikarang Timur sepanjang 3,00 km, dan Zona IX Cikarang Timur - Karawang Barat sepanjang 9,58 km.

Ministry of PUPR Discusses Jakarta-Cikampek Flyover Tariff Scheme
01 Nov 2019, 06:42 by Antara, Kodrat Setiawan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Head of the Toll Road Regulatory Agency (BPJT) of the Ministry of Public Works and Public Housing (PUPR) Danang Parikesit said that the tariff scheme for the Jakarta-Cikampek (Japek) Toll Road II is being discussed by various related parties.
Danang Parikesit in the release of the Ministry of PUPR received in Jakarta, Friday, November 1, 2019, stated that the tariff scheme was being discussed and adjusted to the tariffs on the existing toll road section or to be balanced. "We continue to discuss with the Directorate General of Highways and PT. Jasa Marga, hopefully the scheme can be agreed upon before Christmas," he said.
The Ministry of PUPR accelerated the construction of Japek II along 36.4 kilometers, where the toll road was built to smooth the flow of goods and support the activities of the metropolitan area which is currently very crowded.
The Jakarta Cikampek II Flyover is expected to support the smooth mobility of logistics transportation from Tanjung Priok Port to the three industrial zones in Cikarang, Karawang, and Cibitung as well as the traffic flow from Jakarta towards Bandung and towards the Trans Java Toll Road.
"According to the direction of the Minister of PUPR, Japek II Toll Road should be put into operation at the end of November or early December 2019 so that it can be used during the upcoming Christmas and New Year holidays," he said.
Lap Japek II Toll Road is located right in part of the existing Jakarta-Cikampek Toll Road, stretching from the Cikunir section to West Karawang (Sta 9 + 500 to Sta 47 + 500).
Its operations are carried out by PT Jasamarga Jalanlayang Cikampek (JJC) Toll Road Business Entity (JJC) which is a subsidiary of PT. Jasa Marga.
The Jakarta-Cikampek II Elevated Toll Road construction project is a form of joint operation (KSO) between PT Waskita Karya (Persero) Tbk and PT Acset Indonusa Tbk, with construction costs of Rp 11.69 trillion.
In addition there are nine Construction Zones namely, Zone I Cikunir - West Bekasi along 2.94 km, Zone II West Bekasi - East Bekasi along 3.42 km, Zone III East Bekasi - Tambun along 4.40 km, Zone IV Tambun - Cibitung along 3.30 km, Zona V Cibitung - Cikarang Utama along 4.66 km, Zone VI Cikarang Utama - West Cikarang along 1.96 km, Zone VII West Cikarang - Cibatu along 3.11 km, Zone VIII Cibatu - East Cikarang along 3.00 km, and Zone IX East Cikarang - West Karawang along 9.58 km.
